column4: Hello, I have an HP nx7010 laptop, with ATI 9200 and default screen resolution is 1600 x 1050. When I try to use fglrx through Xor.conf, after rebooting I got a black screen instead of gnome. What can I do ?
how did you install it?
from Synaptic
you followed the wiki?
yes I did run it, throug sudo  dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg
I heard that this is because the resoultion is too high 1600 x 1050
afterwards I have added some modle lines to my Xorg.conf, that I read this from some post. But it didn't work.
try using the binary driver from ati.com, if you have a laptop, that helps -- especially with powersaving and resume after suspend.
and not fglrx ?
pastebin your xorg.conf and your Xorg.0.log file
hangon
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/25952/
when I make driver "fglrx" instead of "ati" I got black screen
did you get the post ?
follow the wiki guide to install the ati drivers from ati.com
ok I got it but what about fglrx ?
just follow the instructions and you'll end up with fglrx
ok thanks I'll check it out now
in that howto there are two guides, one is to use fglrx, which is appereantly now working. The other one is "Using the drivers from ati.com" . So should I proceed with the latter ?
yes, you want the 'use drivers from ati.com'
used the drivers from saveas. It didn't work. I rebooted  and I got black screen again. Then I reverted the Xorg.conf. And booted
